''See also'' '''[[Test]]''', '' and'' '''[[ţest]]'''
==English== ===Etymology=== < [[w:Old French language|Old French]][[Category:English terms derived from Old French|test]] [[test#Old French|test]] (“an earthen vessel, especially a pot in which metals were tried”) < Latin[[Category:English terms derived from Latin|test]] [[testum|testum]] (“the lid of an earthen vessel, an earthen vessel, an earthen pot, in Medieval Latin especially an earthenpot in which metals were tried; compare [[testa|testa]] (“a piece of burned clay, a potsherd”)”) < *terstus, past participle of the root seen also in [[terra|terra]] for *tersa (“dry land”); see [[terra]], [[thirst]]. ===Pronunciation=== * [[w:IPA chart for English|IPA]]: /tɛst/, [[w:SAMPA chart_for_English|SAMPA]]: /tEst/ *

* Rhymes: [[Rhymes:English:-ɛst|-ɛst]] ===Adjective=== '''test''' ([[Category:English adjectives|test]]''not [[Appendix:Glossary‎#comparable|comparable]]''[[Category:English uncomparable adjectives|test]]) # ([[cricket]][[Category:en:Cricket|test]]) Of a [[Test match]]. #: ''His '''test''' average was nearly 100.'' ===Noun=== [[Category:English nouns|test]]'''test''' (''plural'' '''[[tests#English|tests]]''') # A [[challenge#Noun|challenge]]. # (Academics) An [[examination]], given often during the academic [[term]]. # A [[session]] in which a product or piece of equipment is [[examine]]d under everyday or extreme conditions to [[evaluate]] its [[durability]], etc. # ([[cricket]][[Category:en:Cricket|test]]) (normally “[[Test]]”) A [[Test match]]. # ([[marine biology]][[Category:en:Marine biology|test]]) The external [[calciferous]] shell, or [[endoskeleton]], of an [[echinoderm]], e.g. [[sand dollar|sand dollars]] and [[sea urchin|sea urchins]].[[Image:Sea urchin tests.jpg|thumb|right|Two sea urchin tests]] ====Synonyms==== * (challenge): [[challenge]], [[trial]] * (academics, examination): [[quiz]], [[examination]] ====Antonyms==== * (challenge): [[breeze]] * (academics, examination): [[recess]] ====Derived terms====

===Verb=== '''test''' (''third-person singular simple present'' '''[[tests#English|tests]]''', ''present participle'' '''[[testing#English|testing]]''', ''simple past and past participle'' '''[[tested#English|tested]]''')[[Category:English verbs|test]] # To [[challenge#Verb|challenge]]. # (Academics) To administer or assign an examination that is given often during the academic term. # To place a product or piece of equipment under everyday and/or extreme conditions and examine it for its durability, etc. # ([[Appendix:Glossary#copulative|copulative]][[Category:English copulative verbs]]) To be shown to be by test. #: ''He '''tested''' positive for cancer.'' ====Translations====
to challenge
